responses: Top notes are the scents that appear immediately after spraying the perfume and usually last up to 30 minutes. Ingredients often include citrus fruits and fresh, vibrant scents.
Middle notes, also known as heart notes, may emerge alongside top notes but typically take 10-30 minutes to become more pronounced on the skin.
Base notes are the longest-lasting scents in a fragrance. Common base notes include oak, woods, patchouli, musk, and vanilla.
Fragrances without top, middle, and base notes are referred to as flat or linear scents, lacking the complexity of layered notes.
The different notes work together to create a fragrance's overall profile, evolving over time as you wear it.

responses: Eau De Toilette and Eau De Parfum refer to the concentration of essential oils in the fragrance. However, the exact percentages can vary by manufacturer.

Here’s a general guideline for fragrance concentrations: Eau Fraiche (3% or less), Eau de Cologne (2-5%), Eau de Toilette (4-10%), Eau de Parfum (8-15%), Soie de Parfum (15-18%), and Parfum or Extrait (15-25%).
You may also see the term Parfum de Toilette, which describes a concentration similar to Eau De Parfum or between Eau De Parfum and Eau De Toilette.

Perfume bottles are often filled with nitrogen, which can help preserve the fragrance if the bottle has never been opened.
